The source of the claim: The expert's verdict highlights that the claim originated from an article published on the World News Daily Report (WNDR) website, which is known for publishing fictional content.
Lack of evidence: The expert points out that there is no concrete evidence provided in the claim to support the assertion of a donut shortage in Canada after the legalization of recreational marijuana use.
Unreliable nature of the source: The expert emphasizes that the WNDR website is an entertainment site and carries a disclaimer stating that its content is fictional, indicating that the claim cannot be considered as credible news.
Alternative news story: The expert mentions a real news story reported by CNN about a 9-year-old girl selling Girl Scout cookies outside a dispensary during Canada's first day of legal marijuana sales. This story, although unrelated to the claim, is presented as a comparison to highlight the fictional nature of the donut shortage claim.
